body.body:
In the male dominated field of archeology, Dr. Monica Hanna has been pushing to share Egypt's rich history with the world. Have a watch and see how she's doing that with some help from our friends at Google.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Collin Kriner
### Color Grade: MPC London
### Audio Mix: Jungle London

Our friends at Facebook reminding us to call our moms.

### Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Olivia Merrion
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

This one has it all: the desert, bandanas, dirt bikes, and donuts (not the kind you eat). Shot entirely on 16mm, we made this sweet brand film for our friends at Bandits Bandanas that captures what it would look like if a bunch of bandit friends were to kick some tires in the desert. We had too much fun with this one; just watch it.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Director: David McMurry
### Editor: Luke Kraman

Robinhood has pretty much no fees. Which is free money. And when you add the interest you earn with Robinhood, that's even more free money. So here are some sweet ideas about how to spend free money. You're welcome.

### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Editor: Jonathan Flookes
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

When a group of bad-ass biker women invite you to chronicle their worldwide motorcycle relay, you say yes. It was an honor to be asked along for the ride with our friends at Google. Check out the film to see how real sisterhood rolls right over anything that stands in the way.

### Production: WTBR
### Editorial: Google

Have you checked your internet security lately? The folks at GS&P roped us in to help Xfinity break it down so we can all understand what the internet is. At least how to be secure in it, anyway.

### Editorial: GS&P
### Live Action: WTBR

In a time where we are physically distant, our friend over at Facebook wanted to remind us that we can be in constant contact digitally. 

### Post Production: WTBR
### Editor: James Boger
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

Traditions are some of the most fun things we can pass on to future generations. Our friends at Pinterest asked us to help tell Lisa Lynn's story on how she learned to make dumpligs with her mom and how she's made them her own.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Luke Kraman
### Audio Mix & Color: MFD

You ever come across a group of trucks sitting around not hauling stuff and think, "Hey, these trucks should be hauling stuff." Well, that's what Chiamaka thought too. Check out the film to see how she used Google maps to revolutionize the people of Ghana's access to... well... everything.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR

When Diishan Imira got his MBA, most of his classmates went to work at big name consultancies and Fortune 500 companies. He, on the other hand, started selling hair extensions out of the trunk of his Toyota Corolla. Now he’s built a beauty industry juggernaut and a community of 50,000+ entrepreneurs of color who are funneling Big Beauty profits back into their own neighborhoods.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Director: Olivia Merrion
### Editor: Luke Kraman
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

No one likes to cram for exams. But it’s hard to stop playing beer pong when you’re on a roll. And now you don’t have to. Thanks to our friends at barrettSF and Course Hero for helping us help them help students get smarterer.

### Production & Direction: WTBR
### Editor: Dashiell Reinhardt
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

Xfinity and GS&P asked us to help test how good their parental controls were. So we asked some kids about the plots to movies like Human Centipede and Silence of the Lambs. Thankfully, their answers were entertaining and wildly inaccurate.

### Production: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Editorial: GSP

body.body:
There’s a lot of hope invested in that mythical someday when people are free, systems are fair, opportunities are fair, and compensation is equitable. We were thrilled when Luna Bar asked us to help them document another step toward making that someday today.

### Post: WTBR
### Creative & Editorial: Megan Brooks
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

body.body:
You know what’s fun about a job with super heroes, cheeseburgers, and adorable kids? The super heroes. And the cheeseburgers. And the adorable kids. Thanks to the Pitch Agency for bringing us in on this one.

### Production: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Creative & Post: Pitch Agency

How hard could it be to animate a CG shoe…for the record, it’s extremely difficult. We partnered up with our homies across the bay at Butler, Shine, Stern & Partners to unleash the FJ Fury’s inner booty. A technical symphony that balances lightweight, responsive comfort with a powerful cushioning and form-fitting structure to create the ultimate golf shoe.

### Creative: BSSP
### 2D/3D Design & Animation: WTBR
### VFX Director: Simon Mowbray

body.body:
This edition of our Dropbox doc series gives us an inside look at how the talented craftsfolk at  Martin Sign Company do what they do.

### Production, Direction, & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Jonathan Flookes
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

How should we use tech in education? We had the great fortune to spend some time with some great school kids, ages 5-17, to find out. We asked asked them some tough questions (e.g. What does the the nebula NGC 6543 look like?" and " What's the hydrologic cycle?"), and then gave them the tools to investigate for themselves. And while they found answers, what was more exciting was that they found inspiration to explore ideas which only minutes before seemed dry, abstract, and confusing.

### Production: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

hoverImage.title: WTBR Website GIF 019 HP Unstanderdized Answers

body.body:
Where would be without travel? It introduces us to new people, sparks new ideas, and helps us move forward. We’re proud to have worked with Airbnb to produce this piece in response to the Supreme Court’s recent upholding of the travel ban.

### Post: WTBR
### Editor: Megan Brooks
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

The ask: create a library of video content that can be sliced and diced into any number of lengths (60s, 30s, 15s, 06s, and GIFS), showcasing the diverse interests of different consumer groups and the food they love. The answer: lots of match cuts, and lots of costume changes. Special shout out to our production designers who turned a white kitchen yellow. And red. And also blue.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Editor: Jonathan Flookes
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

body.body:
The SFJFF asked us to help create a series of trailers expressing the broad appeal of their films, while also nodding to the undeniable impact of Jewish culture. And in shooting over 30 ad-libbed mini-scenes in 2 days, we had a blast doing it.

### Creative, Production, & Editorial: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Editor: Russel Fong
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

Our latest in a series of documentary profiles on collaboration for Dropbox. This time, we traveled to Lisbon to see how the folks at The Lonely Planet connect writers, designers, and developers all over the globe to produce the best travel guides in the business.

### Production, Direction, & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Russel Fong
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

body.body:
It’s always exciting when a brand wants to take a stand and show what they believe in. So when Airbnb asked us to help craft another piece about acceptance — this one what some have termed as “shithole” countries — to air before the president’s 2018 State of the Union address, we jumped at the chance.

### Post: WTBR
### Editor: Megan Brooks
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

When you’ve got a big thirst, and only the best will do: Pull up a glass of California Olive Ranch Extra Virgin Olive Oil, and drink it down. This guy did. Also, fancy ladies can wear it as perfume. And it makes you want to dance. And it turns your house into a fancy restaurant.

Point being: it’s very good. And we’re super thrilled to have gotten the chance to work with the world’s friendliest olive people.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Russel Fong
### Color Grade: MFD
### Audio Mix: Handsome Sound

hoverImage.title: WTBR Website GIF 005 California Olive Ranch

body.body:
Julian Edelman. New England Patriot. All-pro wide receiver. Two-time Super Bowl Champion. And children’s book author? That’s right. Taking a cue from “Flying High,” his book about a hard-working squirrel who learns to overcome physical limitations, we hauled our 16mm camera out and braved the subzero Boston winter to make this charming film for Dropbox.

### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Russel Fong
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

100% of WTBR staff learned to breakdance with Panasonic boom boxes. So we were pretty jazzed when they asked us to make a film celebrating their 100th birthday. We really went ham on this one, which feels a like a live action #fbf. It's ok if you have to look that one up.

body.body:
When a client asks if you want to make a Holiday film starring 20 puppies, you say yes.

And hey, if that that film turns out to be Hulu’s #1 movie Christmas week, beating out classics like Home Alone, A Christmas Story, and Die Hard, well, let’s just say maybe there really is a Santa Claus.

### Creative: Muh-Tay-Zik Hof-Fer
### Production & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: David Goldstein

Some of our friends asked us if we wanted to help film an artsy dance film for the SF Dance Film Festival. We said yes, well, because there’s dancing. And arrows. And axes. Many thanks to everyone who lent a hand on this one, which is currently making the rounds on the festival circuit.

### Production: WTBR

Thorn is a non-profit that brings together the sharpest minds in tech, government, non-profit, and law enforcement to stop the trafficking of children. We were honored to help them create this mission video announcing their new partnership with Intel to develop facial recognition AI.

### Post: WTBR

body.body:
Sometimes, in life, you have to ask the big questions. The SETI Institute is asking one of the oldest: "Are we alone?" We partnered with Dropbox and the SETI Institute to capture a glimpse of how they're answering it. Which involved huge telescopes and the peering into the cosmic expanse. Pretty good.

### Production, Direction, & Editorial: WTBR
### Editor: Russel Fong
### Color Grade & Audio Mix: MFD

When the work you do makes your 12-year-old self super proud. We had all the fun making these spots for WWE's Supercard game with Barrett SF.

### Creative: BarrettSF
### Post: WTBR
### Director: Brian L. Perkins
### Editor: Chase Roselli

We couldn't imagine a better first project than a collaboration with a bunch of our favorite folks to pay tribute to our nation's Veterans. When our friends at Google told us they were bringing the Veteran's Day Parade to disabled veterans around the country using virtual reality, we were honored to have a part in the telling of that story. The film has been viewed over 15 million times on Facebook and YouTube, earning it the distinction of one of AdAge's top viral videos of the holiday season. Good things.

### Director: Jonathan Zames
### NY Shoot & Edit: Lonely Leap
### CA Shoot: WTBR
